alert.note: Alert for Central and South Weld County; Grand and Summit Counties Below 9000 Feet; Jackson County Below 9000 Feet; Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County; Logan County; Morgan County; Northeast Weld County; Phillips County; Sedgwick County; Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued May 09 at 2:17PM MDT until May 11 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Red flag warning for South Park and the Palmer Divide through 7 pm this evening and again from 11 am to 7 pm Tuesday. Fire Weather Watch in effect Wednesday for North Central and Northeast Colorado except the higher terrain. .Fire weather conditions will be critical across the Palmer Divide the rest of today and on Tuesday, and on Wednesday conditions will be even more widespread. Wind across the Palmer Divide the rest of today and Tuesday will be ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR NORTH AND MIDDLE PARK, THE FOOTHILLS, AND PLAINS The National Weather Service in Denver has issued a Fire Weather Watch for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from Wednesday morning through Wednesday evening. * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zones 211, 213, 238, 242, 243, 244, 248, 249, 250 and 251. * Timing...Fire Weather Watch from 9 am to 9 pm Wednesday. * Winds...South 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 11 percent. * Impacts...Any fire that starts will have the potential to spread rapidly. Avoid burning or any outdoor activity that may produce a spark and start a wildfire.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
